briefTitle: Delafloxacin Versus Vancomycin and Aztreonam for the Treatment of Acute Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infections
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Active-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Delafloxacin Compared With Vancomycin + Aztreonam in Patients With Acute Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infections
conditions: Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue Bacterial Infections
summary: This study was designed to evaluate the efficacy of delafloxacin patients with acute bacterial skin and soft tissue infections (ABSSSI).

primaryOutcome.measure: Objective Response at 48 to 72 Hours (FDA Primary Endpoint)
